title: How closely is the Japan in the anime world related to the real Japan? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would say it totally depends on what anime you are watching… Obviously shounen anime is a very poor example of Japanese culture. It shows over the top stuff, and is meant for purely entertainment purposes. But having said that, there are many slice of life anime, which show interactions between normal human beings. Those might give a look into japanese culture. But it is also not 100% accurate, as TV tropes are always there that exist to give viewers a sense of familiarity and entertainment value. Some stuff that does come out about japanese culture is how they use honorifics while speaking, how respect is given to peers and elders, how they have a system of personal Honor, and the reserved nature of their culture. I would say that don't consider anime culture to be a reflection of life in Japan. Culture in Japan is a bit more stricter than shown in anime. But at the end of the day all fiction is based on truth, and Anime is a great place to start learning about japanese culture.
